sen.j: 精霊棚（しょうりょうだな）は日本の習俗的行事お盆において先祖、精霊を迎えるための棚。
sen.e: Shoryodana is a shelf placed to welcome the ancestors and spirits in the Bon festival, which is a conventional event.

sen.j: 一般的には盆期間中、台の上に真菰のござを敷いたものに、仏壇から取り出した位牌、三具足を飾り、お供え物を置くための棚。
sen.e: Generally, it is an altar covered with a sheet made of Manchurian wild rice, on which a Buddhist mortuary tablet, san gusoku (three elements of the altar), and offerings are arranged during the Bon.
